articles.headline: ‘Brexit’ Vote Has European Workers in Britain Unsure of Future
articles.snippet: If Britain leaves the European Union, visa rules would have a profound impact on employees in the restaurant, hotel and construction industries.
articles.abstract: If Britain leaves the European Union, visa rules would have a profound impact on employees in the restaurant, hotel and construction industries.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Filipe Graca hovered over an espresso machine at the British food chain Pret A Manger and frothed out a cafe latte for a waiting customer. Until last year, he had struggled to find any kind of a job in his native Portugal. But when he arrived in London, he was able to work almost right away.

articles.headline: Held Hostage in an Orlando Restroom, and Playing Dead to Stay Alive
articles.snippet: A man who was trapped for hours with the gunman at the Pulse nightclub described a life-or-death game of deception. Another survivor recalled the killer’s “evil laugh.”
articles.abstract: A man who was trapped for hours with the gunman at the Pulse nightclub described a life-or-death game of deception. Another survivor recalled the killer’s “evil laugh.”
articles.lead_paragraph: ORLANDO, Fla. — As the sound of gunfire in the nightclub grew louder, a patron named Orlando and a female friend took cover in a cramped bathroom stall, contorting their bodies on top of the toilet so their feet could not be seen. The gunman burst into the bathroom, went straight to the stall next to them and shot the people inside.
articles.byline: By Jack Healy and Marc Santora

articles.headline: Liberal Return Policies for Consumers Can Reduce Retail Workers’ Pay
articles.snippet: Department store customers, taking advantage of returns policies set by retailers competing with e-commerce, are playing havoc with sales commissions.
articles.abstract: Department store customers, taking advantage of returns policies set by retailers competing with e-commerce, are playing havoc with sales commissions.
articles.lead_paragraph: Earnestine Gay, a longtime worker in the fragrance department at Macy’s in Herald Square, clearly remembers a bottle of perfume that was returned recently. It was practically empty.

articles.headline: One Unspoken Reason Behind the Microsoft-LinkedIn Deal
articles.snippet: LinkedIn’s struggling stock price, and its reliance on stock-based compensation may be a factor in its sale to Microsoft.
articles.abstract: LinkedIn’s struggling stock price, and its reliance on stock-based compensation may be a factor in its sale to Microsoft.

articles.headline: Omar Mateen, Twice Scrutinized by F.B.I., Shows Threat of Lone Terrorists
articles.snippet: Investigators now face the question of how much the killings were the act of a deeply disturbed man and how much he was driven by religious or political ideology.
articles.abstract: Investigators now face the question of how much the killings were the act of a deeply disturbed man and how much he was driven by religious or political ideology.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When a young American man from coastal Florida drove a truck packed with explosives into a hilltop restaurant in Syria in May 2014, F.B.I. agents scoured his online postings and interviewed his contacts in Florida in a scramble to determine who, if anyone, might try to launch a similar attack inside the United States.
articles.byline: By Mark Mazzetti, Eric Lichtblau and Alan Blinder

articles.headline: Orlando Shootings Stitch Together Gays and Latinos, 2 Cultures Once at Odds
articles.snippet: As friends and families mourned victims who were killed at Pulse nightclub, many noticed a marked seismic shift among Latinos’ acceptance of gay culture.
articles.abstract: As friends and families mourned victims who were killed at Pulse nightclub, many noticed a marked seismic shift among Latinos’ acceptance of gay culture.
articles.lead_paragraph: ORLANDO, Fla. — One of the survivors of Sunday’s attack at the nightclub Pulse, a man closeted from his family, called his Latin American parents abroad to tell them that a close friend — who was actually his partner — had died in the bar. Their response: “You weren’t in that bar, were you?”

articles.headline: How China Won the Keys to Disney’s Magic Kingdom
articles.snippet: Plans for the $5.5 billion Shanghai Disney Resort, which opens Thursday, were in limbo until Disney dialed back its demands to the Communist Party.
articles.abstract: Plans for the $5.5 billion Shanghai Disney Resort, which opens Thursday, were in limbo until Disney dialed back its demands to the Communist Party.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — Disney had pushed China too hard, putting the company’s plans for a new theme park here in limbo. Now, Robert A. Iger wanted to kick the yearslong negotiations into high gear.
articles.byline: By David Barboza and Brooks Barnes

articles.headline: Killing Twice for ISIS and Saying So Live on Facebook
articles.snippet: Larossi Abballa, who stabbed a police captain and his companion to death, was released almost immediately after his conviction in 2013.
articles.abstract: Larossi Abballa, who stabbed a police captain and his companion to death, was released almost immediately after his conviction in 2013.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — He stabbed an off-duty police officer and left him bleeding to death on his own doorstep. He forced his way inside the home and stabbed and killed the officer’s female companion. He then sat down and videotaped himself live on Facebook declaring allegiance to the Islamic State, according to the French law enforcement authorities.
articles.byline: By Alissa J. Rubin and Lilia Blaise

articles.headline: Facebook Offers Tools for Those Who Fear a Friend May Be Suicidal
articles.snippet: Posts that are flagged will be reviewed by the social network, which will provide resources to the concerned friend and offer help to the person at risk.
articles.abstract: Posts that are flagged will be reviewed by the social network, which will provide resources to the concerned friend and offer help to the person at risk.
articles.lead_paragraph: MENLO PARK, Calif. — When Carrie Simmons opened her Facebook app one day in late 2014, she saw a status update from a high school friend she had not seen in years that alarmed her. It read like a suicide note.

articles.headline: Can Apple Think Outside the Device?
articles.snippet: Apple still seems to view online services as add-ons to its devices, not as products or platforms that rise above the equipment.
articles.abstract: Apple still seems to view online services as add-ons to its devices, not as products or platforms that rise above the equipment.
articles.lead_paragraph: More than any other company in tech, Apple prizes physical objects — expensive, perfectly designed, self-contained nuggets of aluminum and glass that you buy today, use for a couple years and replace.

articles.headline: Court Backs Rules Treating Internet as Utility, Not Luxury
articles.snippet: An appeals court panel affirmed the Federal Communications Commission’s rules about net neutrality, clearing the way for stricter oversight of broadband providers.
articles.abstract: An appeals court panel affirmed the Federal Communications Commission’s rules about net neutrality, clearing the way for stricter oversight of broadband providers.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — High-speed internet service can be defined as a utility, a federal court has ruled in a sweeping decision clearing the way for more rigorous policing of broadband providers and greater protections for web users.
